titleStmt.title: Henry D. McHenry to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4342

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Hartford Oct 13th 1863
Gov Bramlett
Dr Sir

I send herewith a Petition to get C W Hunter released from a fine imposed against him for solemnizing the right of Matrimony with authority. He was a Justice of the Peace & supposed he was authorized and it was only one coupled he married & the fine imposed was $25. He is a poor man & cant well afford pay the fine He was afterward authorized by the court to solemize marriage

I am very truly
Henry D McHenry

Ohio Cir Court
vs
C. W. Hinton
$25

Remit all except costs & fees Oct 17th 1863
T E Bramlette
Govr
enclose to Col Henry D McHenry
J P McHenry

We the undersigned citizens of Ohio County respectfully Petition His Excellency the Governor to remit a fine imposed by the Ohio Circuit Court at its last September Term against Charles W Newton for marrying a couple without being authorized so to do by the County Court
Oct 13th 1863.

L Nall
Alf Nall
R P Nall
J G Horn
W. H. Nall
Remis Gibson
J. T Bentard
W E Davis
D S Hill Judge Ohio County Court
S Manzy
Wm Hardwick
Litus Bennett
Robert B Blevines
W. B. Robinson
John Graham
John K Oglesbey
R. S. Moreley Clk Ohio Co Ct.
A. Woodward
Ed. B. Ellis
A. L. Morton Clk Ohio Cir Ct
W. H. Davidson D. C.
A B Bond Post. M
W H Miller
